summary.para: Defines constants that specify types of notifications raised by or IDXCoreAdapterList objects.
You can register and unregister for these notifications by calling IDXCoreAdapterFactory.RegisterEventNotification and IDXCoreAdapterFactory.UnregisterEventNotification, respectively.

member.name: DXCoreNotificationType.AdapterListStale
member.summary: This notification is raised by an IDXCoreAdapterList object when the adapter list becomes stale. The fresh-to-stale transition is one-way, and one-time, so this notification is raised at most one time.

member.name: DXCoreNotificationType.AdapterNoLongerValid
member.summary: This notification is raised by an IDXCoreAdapter object when the adapter becomes no longer valid. The valid-to-invalid transition is one-way, and one-time, so this notification is raised at most one time.

member.name: DXCoreNotificationType.AdapterBudgetChange
member.summary: This notification is raised by an IDXCoreAdapter object when an adapter budget change occurs. This notification can occur many times. Using this notification is functionally similar to . In response to this event, you should call IDXCoreAdapter.QueryState (with ) to evaluate the current memory budget state.

member.name: DXCoreNotificationType.AdapterHardwareContentProtectionTeardown
member.summary: This notification is raised by an IDXCoreAdapter object to notify of an adapter's hardware content protection teardown. This notification can occur many times. It is functionally similar to . In response to this event, you should re-evaluate the current crypto session status; for example, by calling to determine the impact of the hardware teardown for a specific interface.
